thread.title: Pictures portray the truth about Sgt Blackman's CAMP HELL
thread.title_full: Pictures portray the truth about Sgt Blackman's CAMP HELL

title: Pictures portray the truth about Sgt Blackman's CAMP HELL
text: show ad Squalid conditions. Blistering heat. Flimsy defences. And constant terror. Revealed: The pictures that portray the truth about Sgt Blackman's CAMP HELL New photographs, never seen before, were mostly taken on Sgt Blackman’s camera during his tour of duty They reveal Checkpoint Omar, home in 2011 to 16 soldiers from J Company, 42 Commando Royal Marines Court of Appeal heard of ‘austere and hostile’ conditions endured by Sgt Alexander Blackman and his men Base's extreme stresses would culminate in Sgt Blackman and shooting dead a wounded Taliban insurgent Published: 22:00 GMT, 14 February 2017 | Updated: 22:45 GMT, 14 February 2017 9 shares
